Articles.Content:
So, i've had this problem for a couple days now and I have no idea what it could be. I'm sure it's a visual mod, or perhaps a conflict between mods.

What happens is that after I launch a vehicle, be it a jet, or a rocket.   Most of the time when I hit M to bring up the orbital map, I get this strange flickering on the screen.  

It doesn't cause any form of crashing, so I dont have any crash logs, but I'll put up my modlist, maybe someone has seen it before.  

First I thought it was planet shine.  Uninstalled and repeated a launch.  Still happened.

Then I tried without engine lights.  Did the same flight.  Still happened.  

Tried again without SVT., still happened.  

I'm going to keep testing combinations, but I figured i'd ask to see if someone can help before I fix it or end up breaking my install.  

 

Modlist - Warning, it's long.

Spoiler

KSP: 1.2.2 (Win64) - Unity: 5.4.0p4 - OS: Windows 10  (10.0.0) 64bit

Edited May 15, 2017 by Xiyn
Looks like SVE or Scatterer issue. Did you install mods with CKAN?

I has the same problem with GPP and Kopernikus. There was a Kopernikus cfg hotfix that fix this behavour. If im right this glitch you have looks like water texture?

Look/ask at Kopernikus. Hope this helps.

Funny Kabooms 

Urses

7 minutes ago, Pand5461 said:

Looks like SVE or Scatterer issue. Did you install mods with CKAN?

Yes, I do install with CKAN.  I removed both of those during my testing just a few minutes ago and the problem went away.  I'm currently reinstalling them fresh to see if it happens again.  

 

3 minutes ago, Urses said:

I has the same problem with GPP and Kopernikus. There was a Kopernikus cfg hotfix that fix this behavour. If im right this glitch you have looks like water texture?

Look/ask at Kopernikus. Hope this helps.

Funny Kabooms 

Urses 

Really?  I'll head over to that thread and look around.  It does look like the water is wanting to render out on the screen.  Thanks for that.

38 minutes ago, Xiyn said:

Yes, I do install with CKAN.  I removed both of those during my testing just a few minutes ago and the problem went away.  I'm currently reinstalling them fresh to see if it happens again. 

 

If problem persist, I recommend you to check SVE thread to see if anyone had similar problems.

24 minutes ago, Pand5461 said:

If problem persist, I recommend you to check SVE thread to see if anyone had similar problems.

I'll do that.  After manually reinstalling SVE and it's required parts and the problem popped right back up when I launched a new plane.

On 5/15/2017 at 3:44 AM, Xiyn said:

I'll do that.  After manually reinstalling SVE and it's required parts and the problem popped right back up when I launched a new plane.  

i've been fighting this bug and found it is the trajcetories mod that was causing it (for 1.2.2 at least). I'm gonna check the forum to see if it was address in a previous version.
